sub_title: Doctoral degree at ACPA Leiden University
summary: November 2017 I obtained my doctoral degree at the Academy of Creative and Performing Arts (ACPA) at Leiden University. Anybody interested in my findings and ideas about how to develop the (composing) improvisers techniques to operate beyond the limitations of functional harmony can read my writings and enjoy the audio examples by simply using this link https://www.researchcatalogue.net/view/354613/377339

education.degree_name: Doctor of Philosophy - PhD in the Arts

school.name: Codarts Rotterdam | University of the Arts

profile_positions.company: Codarts Rotterdam | University of the Arts
profile_positions.title: Artistic Research Coach Domain Jazz Improvisation, and Coach of Master Ensembles Jazz

profile_positions.company: Codarts Rotterdam | University of the Arts
profile_positions.description:
I am a performing saxophonist and a composer in a variety of ensembles as a side-man, as a soloist, or as a leader.
I am a master-research-coach, and a coordinated and coach of master students' ensembles at the jazz department of Codarts, Rotterdam. 
November 2017 I obtained my doctoral degree at the ACAP of Leiden University. See below for the link to my online dissertation titled Beyond Borders: Broadening the Artistic Palette of (Composing) Performers in Jazz. Promotors were prof. Marcel Cobussen, prof. Walter van de Leur and Frank Carlberg.
profile_positions.title: jazz saxophonist, student PhD researcher and teacher/coach

profile_positions.description: Performance Artist on tenor and soprano saxophones, composer, promotor of jazz and jazz-related ensembles: solo performances with or without lecture, Bach Reflections Solo, Dick de Graaf Quartet, individual and band coaching.
profile_positions.title: creative and managing director

profile_positions.description:
From the eighties on, I have performed at many national and international jazzstages with a.o. Chet Baker, Misha Mengelberg, Jasper van ’t Hof, Kenny Weeler, Tom Harrell, Benny Golson, Billy Hart, Toumani Diabaté and Erkan Ogur  in Europe, South and West Africa, the USA, Japan, Indonesia, New Zealand, USA and Canada.
I have recorded 25+  CD’s that received positive response by both public and press. My Challenge Records Awarded CD’s ‘Sailing’ and ‘New York Straight Ahead’ got ****critics in Down Beat magazine.
My project ‘The Burning of the Midnight Lamp: Dick de Graaf plays Jimi Hendrix’ appeared to be very succesful.  With this Septet project drew  full houses in Holland, Germany, Austria, Ireland and Finland. 
In june 2003 the CD SCHUBERT IMPRESSIONS FOR JAZZ QUINTET was presented at the Northsea Jazz Festival followed by an international concert tour. Following these Schubert Impressions I presented another jazz-meets-classic project A TOUCH OF BELA in Hungary during the Esztergom Bela Bartok Festival in july 2005. June 2007 I was commissioned to write and play my Bach Reflections at the famous Bach Feste in Leipzig.
An immense series of projects followed: Trio Nuevo: Jazz Meets Tango (2006), my acoustic Dick de Graaf Quartet (2007), my powerjazz quartet CRY BABY! (2009), my solo improvisations with Bach’s cello suites (2010), and  trio  Out Of The Blues with its 2012 CD CELEBRATING THE MUSIC OF OLIVER NELSON. 
Beside I was the musical director of the  Clazz Ensemble from 2007 until 2016, and of Italian pianist Andrea Pozza’s European Quintet (I, GB,NL).
Most recently, with my Dick de Graaf Quartet I released the CD BIRD BUZZ (2017) with pieces inspired by the (ordinary) birds around my house, created in the context of the doctoral research project I finished in november 2017.
August 2021 will be my 40th anniversary as a professional performer, more about that will follow shortly.
I am an endorser and international clinician for D'Addario reeds
profile_positions.title: free-lance saxofonist, composer and producer
